review_title: Poorly managed, office is not legally established, no human resource
pros:
An opportunity to work in a Spanish / Latin environment, and to know Spanish language and culture
Get some friends from Spain (if you are lucky)
Get invited to Spain to visit the University (if it is your destiny)
Colleagues that are like your own family and very supportive to each other
Parking fee reimbursment
Religious Holiday Allowance
Max. 2 days of menstrual rest for women monthly
Good project management system
Green IT (85% of works already using electronic documents)
Project Completion Certification for software projects
Entrance Training and Certification for software team
Suitable for internships
cons:
Office is legally not established (Physically, the office is available and is operating since June 2012, but still not legalized)
Unclear and unprofessional employment contracts, e.g: working hours not specified, a job position of Language School Manager but the responsibilities are for Software Engineer
Very bad compensation and benefits
No career path 
Most of the months, salary comes very late
Not suitable for permanent/contract employments
